sen.j: 休子内親王（きゅうし（やすこ）ないしんのう、保元2年（1157年） - 嘉応3年3月1日 (旧暦)（1171年4月7日））は、平安時代末期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Kyushi (Yasuko) (1157 - April 7, 1171) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of the Heian Period.
Imperial Princess Kyushi (Yasuko) (1157 - April 7, 1171) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of the Heian Period.
Imperial Princess Kyushi (Yasuko) (1157 - April 7, 1171) was a member of the Imperial family at the end of the Heian Period.
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).
Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 後白河天皇の第4皇女で、母は従二位藤原成子（藤原季成女）。
sen.e: She was the fourth daughter of the Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was FUJIWARA no Shigeko, a Junii (Junior Second Rank), and the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suenari.
She was the fourth daughter of the Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was FUJIWARA no Shigeko, a Junii (Junior Second Rank), and the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suenari.
She was the fourth daughter of the Emperor Goshirakawa, and her mother was FUJIWARA no Shigeko, a Junii (Junior Second Rank), and the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suenari.

sen.j: 同母兄姉に亮子内親王（殷富門院）・好子内親王・式子内親王・守覚法親王・以仁王がいる。
sen.e: Her siblings with the same mother include the Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), the Imperial Princess Koshi (Yoshiko), the Imperial Princess Noriko (Shikishi), the Priestly Imperial Prince Shukaku and the Prince Mochihito.

Her siblings with the same mother include the Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), the Imperial Princess Koshi (Yoshiko), the Imperial Princess Noriko (Shikishi), the Priestly Imperial Prince Shukaku and the Prince Mochihito.

Her siblings with the same mother include the Imperial Princess Ryoshi (Inpumonin), the Imperial Princess Koshi (Yoshiko), the Imperial Princess Noriko (Shikishi), the Priestly Imperial Prince Shukaku and the Prince Mochihito.

sen.j: 仁安 元年（1166年）12月甥六条天皇の斎宮に卜定され、翌年の仁安2年（1167年）6月初斎院（大膳職）に入った。
sen.e: In December 1166, she was selected by fortune telling to be the Saigu for her nephew, the Emperor Rokujo, and in June, 1167 entered into the Shosaiin (Hall of Initial Abstinence)) - Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In December 1166, she was selected by fortune telling to be the Saigu for her nephew, the Emperor Rokujo, and in June, 1167 entered into the Shosaiin (Hall of Initial Abstinence) - Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table).

In December 1166, she was selected by fortune telling to be the Saigu for her nephew, the Emperor Rokujo, and in June, 1167 entered into the Shosaiin (Hall of Initial Abstinence) - Daizenshiki (Office of the Palace Table).

sen.j: 同年9月野宮に入ったが、仁安3年（1168年）2月、六条天皇譲位のため群行をしないまま退下した。
sen.e: In September of the same year, she entered the Nonomiya (Field Palace), but she returned in February 1168 without finishing the Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and returned to Ise) due to the abdication from the throne of Emperor Rokujo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In September of the same year, she entered the Nonomiya (Field Palace), but she returned in February 1168 without finishing the Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and returned to Ise) due to the abdication from the throne of Emperor Rokujo.

In October of the same year, she entered the Nonomiya (Field Palace), but she returned in March 1168 without finishing the Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and returned to Ise) due to the abdication from the throne of Emperor Rokujo.
sen.cmt: "September"→"October"に変更しました。"February"→"March"に変更しました。

sen.j: 嘉応3年（1171年）3月1日、15歳で薨去。
sen.e: On March 1, 1171, she died at the age of 15.
On March 1, 1171, she died at the age of 15.
On April 14, 1171, she died at the age of 15.
